subject: AI & Agents
title: Batching and Throughput
description: A 60-second lesson on Batching and Throughput.

hook.text: Your API handles one user at a time. A hundred users are waiting.

buildup.text: Batching groups multiple requests into one GPU pass, filling idle compute.

discovery.text: Continuous batching (like vLLM) adds new requests to a running batch without waiting.

twist.text: Larger batches increase throughput but also increase per-request latency.

climax.text: Measure tokens-per-second (throughput) AND time-to-first-token (latency). Balance both.

punchline.text: GPUs hate waiting. Keep them busy.

quiz.question: What does continuous batching improve?
options: Throughput by adding requests to a running batch
